timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure if this init array size is good or not. Please take a look.
timeline.author: HTHou

replies.bodyText: In the worst case, it may waste nearly half memory of startTimes and endTimes. From this point of view, I think it may be not a better choice than Map<String, long[]> deviceToStartEndTime.
replies.author: fanhualta

replies.bodyText:
Here is an advice from @qiaojialin. When closing a resource, remove the redundant length of startTimes and endTimes. And when enlarging the arrays, use  * 1.5 instead.
By the way, the maximum number of devices in this TsFileResource shouldn't exceed the number of devices in the storage group. I'm looking for a way to find out this number.
replies.author: HTHou

timeline.bodyText: You will read the time twice if it's valid. It's better to recording the result of getStartTime(deviceId) with temporary variables.
timeline.author: fanhualta

timeline.bodyText: You will read the time twice if it's valid. It's better to recording the result of getStartTime(deviceId) with temporary variables.
timeline.author: fanhualta
fanhualta

timeline.bodyText: If we already have the index info, that is entry.getValue(). It will be more efficient to get from endTimes by index directly. Otherwise, it will hash twice and find in bucket in ConcurrentHashMap. Other iterations have similar problems, please have a look too.
timeline.author: fanhualta
fanhualta
fanhualta

timeline.bodyText: You can fill startTime by MAX_VALUE and fill endTimes by MIN_VALUE
